conclusion: To find the magnitude of the normal force F exerted by the ground on A and the magnitude of the frictional force f.
Sphere C is symmetrically placed between A and B.
Sphere C is in equilibrium, so the forces acting on it must balance.
The weight of C is mg.
The normal force from A and B on C are equal, denoted as N.
The angle formed by the normal forces from A and B with the horizontal is 30 degrees.
Using vertical equilibrium: 2N cos(30 degrees) = mg, N = mg/sqrt(3).
Sphere A is also in equilibrium.
Normal force from the ground on A is F.
Normal force from C on A has a horizontal component.
Using vertical equilibrium for A: F = mg + N sin(30 degrees), F = mg(1 + sqrt(3)/6).
Using horizontal equilibrium for A: f = N cos(30 degrees), f = mg/2.
The magnitude of the normal force F exerted by the ground on A is (6 + sqrt(3))/6 mg.
The magnitude of the frictional force f is mg/2.
